com.wookler.server.common.utils

Class Monitoring

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wookler.server.common.utils.Monitoring

  • public class Monitoring
extends Object
    Helper class to encapsulate all monitoring calls. The reason these calls are encapsulated is to avoid runtime exceptions. Monitoring is expected to ignore exceptions and just log them to STDERR. If exceptions are not to be ignored, calls to the Monitor class can be made directly.
    Author:
    Subho Ghosh (subho dot ghosh at outlook.com)

      • addGlocalCounter

        public static AbstractCounter addGlocalCounter(AbstractCounter counter)
        Add a Global Counter. Global counters are expected to be of type concurrent counters which are thread safe.
        Parameters:
        counter - - Counter to add.
        Returns:
        - Added counter handle.

      • increment

        public static AbstractCounter increment(String namespace,
                                        String name)
        Increment the specified Global counter by 1. Incremented counter must by of type Count.
        Parameters:
        namespace - - Counter namespace
        name - - Counter name.
        Returns:
        - Counter that was incremented.

      • timerstop

        public static AbstractCounter timerstop(long starttime,
                                        long count,
                                        String namespace,
                                        String name)
        Utility function to stop and update a running timer.
        Parameters:
        starttime - - Timer create time in millis
        count - - Operation count increment.
        namespace - - Counter namespace.
        name - - Counter name.
        Returns:
        - Update counter or NULL.
